senses.de: To interrupt or bother someone or something
senses.ex: Please do not disturb her, she is studying right now.

Tips.title: Request Politeness
Tips.description: Used when asking for quiet or non-interruption in a polite or formal way.
Tips.example: The sign on the door says 'Please do not disturb.'

Tips.title: Cultural Respect
Tips.description: In some cultures, it's very disrespectful to disturb elders or people in authority.
Tips.example: Out of respect, the students remained silent not to disturb the master.

senses.de: To cause someone to feel upset, worried, or uneasy
senses.ex: The news about the accident really disturbed him.

Tips.title: Emotional Impact
Tips.description: Often relates to news or events that negatively affect a person’s emotions.
Tips.example: The gloomy weather seemed to disturb his normally cheerful mood.

Tips.title: Personal Boundaries
Tips.description: When personal thoughts or feelings are intruded upon by external factors.
Tips.example: Discovering the diary was read disturbed her deeply.

senses.de: To move or shift out of its usual or regular place
senses.ex: They were asked not to disturb the ancient remains.

Tips.title: Physical Alteration
Tips.description: Refers to changing the position or condition of a physical object or space.
Tips.example: Please avoid disturbing the items on the desk, they're arranged for a reason.

Tips.title: Environmentally Sensitive
Tips.description: Used in the context of environmental conservation to avoid harm.
Tips.example: Tourists are warned not to disturb the natural habitats.

senses.de: To upset or interfere with the normal state or progression of something
senses.ex: Overfishing has seriously disturbed the balance of marine life.

Tips.title: System Disruption
Tips.description: Often used when talking about interrupting processes, routines, or systems.
Tips.example: Striking workers disturbed the company’s daily operations.

Tips.title: Balance Importance
Tips.description: Indicates the importance of maintaining stability in various systems or situations.
Tips.example: The new policy disturbed the balance of power in the organization.

Agitate.wordDefinition:
Agitate means to stir up or cause someone to be excited or upset about a particular issue or situation. It is a deliberate action taken to provoke emotions or reactions in people, for example, agitating for social justice or equal rights.

Agitate is more about intentional actions to cause a reaction, and disturb is more about unintentional actions that cause an interruption in someone's calm or comfort.

Alarm.wordDefinition: Alarm means to create a sense of danger or urgency, to warn someone about a potential threat or danger. For example, smoke alarm warns people about a fire, an alarm clock warns people to wake up.

Annoy.wordDefinition:
Annoy means to irritate or bother someone, usually in a mild or temporary way. For example, a sibling may annoy you by tapping their foot loudly while you're trying to study.

Both words describe actions that affect someone negatively, but annoy is generally less serious and more temporary, while disturb is more serious and long-lasting.

Disrupt.wordDefinition:
Disrupt and disturb both mean to interrupt or cause an upset in something.

Disrupt is a stronger word and describes a situation where something is completely thrown off course. For example, if a power outage disrupts a concert, it means the entire event is cancelled or at least delayed significantly.

Disrupt is used when something is completely thrown off course, while disturb is used for a more mild interruption.

Irritate.wordDefinition:
Irritate means to cause annoyance, frustration, or anger in someone. It often refers to something that is repeated or ongoing.

For instance: a person who constantly interrupts a conversation can irritate others. Lingering, high pitched noise emitted by construction can irritate individuals in the surrounding area.

In summary, both words involve a kind of disturbance, but disturb is about interrupting or upsetting something, while irritate is more about causing annoyance or frustration in someone.

Perturb.wordDefinition:
Perturb means to make someone worried, anxious or upset, causing them to feel emotionally unsettled.

Both words refer to disruptions or disturbances, but disturb is generally used for physical or environmental disturbances, while perturb is typically used to describe emotional or mental disturbances.

Pester.wordDefinition:
Pester means to repeatedly bother or annoy someone or something. This can be applicable when someone repeatedly asks for something that someone else does not want to do or getting someone's attention in an irritating way.

The main difference is that disturb is a one-time disruption, while pester is a repetitive annoyance.

Ruffle.wordDefinition:
Disturb and ruffle are both verbs that mean to cause a disturbance, but their meanings differ slightly.

Ruffle means to cause agitation, disarrange, or irritate.

Example: The wind ruffled the leaves on the trees.

Disturb is more commonly used to describe disruptions to people or plans, while ruffle is more commonly used to describe disruptions to physical objects or materials.

Upset.wordDefinition:
Upset means to emotionally or mentally destabilize someone.

It can describe a feeling of anger, sadness, or disappointment. For example, if someone fails a test, they may feel upset because they did not achieve what they wanted.

Disturb refers to something physical or external that affects a person, while upset refers to something emotional or mental that affects a person.

quotes.Text: Sometimes when you're playing a very intense character, a disturbed character, you find other layers. That's much more interesting to me, rather than just playing 'intense.' I find it too boring.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Irrfan Khan

quotes.Text: That made me feel very disturbed, because it never seemed to be about how much hard work was involved. Ever. It was about... 'hazel eyes'. It does help if you can brush that stuff off.
quotes.Title: British Actress
quotes.Name: Julia Ormond

quotes.Text: Look at what's happening in this world. Every day there's something exciting or disturbing to write about. With all that's going on, how could I stop?
quotes.Title: American Poet
quotes.Name: Gwendolyn Brooks

quotes.Text: The function of the artist in a disturbed society is to give awareness of the universe, to ask the right questions, and to elevate the mind.
quotes.Title: Serbian Artist
quotes.Name: Marina Abramovic

quotes.Text: The man who is forever disturbed about the condition of humanity either has no problems of his own or has refused to face them.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Henry Miller

quotes.Text: I like to stay within the zone of one character. It would disturb me to break away and go into an entirely different territory.
quotes.Title: Indian Director
quotes.Name: Farhan Akhtar

quotes.Text: When I was single my career was my life, so everything I did was of grave importance and was greatly disturbing.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Rickie Lee Jones

quotes.Text: There's always been something deeply disturbing about the Abbott government's attitude to women.
quotes.Title: Australian Novelist
quotes.Name: Richard Flanagan

quotes.Text: Interviews are vital, but you cannot allow an interviewer to take your life and disturb it.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: Jerry Lewis

quotes.Text: I find it kind of disturbing when people cheer when someone just gets stabbed brutally.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Rick Baker
